arts.ttl: Championship: Coventry storm back to beat Baggies, Saints thrash Charlton 5-1
arts.sum: Leaders come back from 2-0 down to claim victory Southampton’s five-star first half stuns the Addicks Leaders Coventry came from two goals behind to beat 10-man West Brom 3-2 in a thriller at the CBS Arena. Two goals from Aune Heggebø put the visitors ahead, but Josh Eccles halved the deficit before the break. After Jayson Molumby had been sent off four minutes into the second half, Ellis Simms and Victor Torp were on target to make it nine wins in 10 for Coventry. Molumby had fouled Ephron Mason-Clark in the first half that led to a clash and both players were booked. Molumby then pulled back Torp to prevent a counterattack and was shown a second yellow card on 49 minutes. This story will be updated Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Southampton thump five past stunned Charlton
arts.sum: Southampton continued their excellent form under interim manager Tonda Eckert as they thrashed Charlton 5-1 at The Valley.
